snippet: Two species of deep-sea dwelling, mushroom-shaped organisms discovered off the coast of Southeast Australia defy all existing classifications of life.
abstract: Study in journal PLoS One reports discovery of two species of deep-sea dwelling, mushroom-shaped organisms, named Dendrogramma enigmatica, off the coast of Southeast Australia that researchers say defy all existing classifications of life.
lead_paragraph: Two species of deep-sea dwelling, mushroom-shaped organisms discovered off the coast of Southeast Australia defy all existing classifications of life.

headline.main: Unlike Anything They Have Ever Seen Before
headline.print_headline: Marine Life: Unlike Anything They Have Ever Seen Before
